intro: Junellia connatibracteata, commonly known as the narrow-bract junellia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Junellia connatibracteata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
